column4: chroot fails with some stupid error about /bin/sh
chroot can't execute '/bin/sh': Exec format error
and this is assuming you have sda1 mounted there
yup sda on mnt both disc and os are 64 bit
type "mount" to see if anything is mounted inside /mnt to prevent your from unmounting
I'm in the 12.04 installer disc rescue mode , lsof isn't even on it
do you have any terminals that are sitting in /mnt?
there is only 1 terminal, it's a fresh boot
how did sda1 get mounted in the first place?
